triples.name: Signalling theory
triples.relevance: The foundational theoretical framework that this review examines across organizational settings and applications.

triples.name: Decision-making
triples.relevance: Core to signaling theory as signals help decision-makers select better options when facing incomplete information.

triples.name: Communication theory
triples.relevance: The paper examines signaling as a communication mechanism where signalers send observable signals carrying information.

triples.name: Information asymmetry
triples.relevance: The core problem signaling theory addresses, where one party has incomplete or imperfect information about unobservable qualities.

triples.name: Organizational behavior
triples.relevance: The primary domain where this review applies signaling theory to explain behavior within and among organizations.

triples.name: Organizational theory
triples.relevance: The field of management studies that serves as the context for examining organizational applications of signaling theory.
